user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_mv:
```c
int32 OS_mv(const char *src, const char *dest)
{
    int32 return_code;

    /* First try rename - this only works if it is on the same filesystem */
    return_code = OS_rename(src, dest);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_cp(src, dest);
        if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
        {
            OS_remove(src);
        }
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No explicit compiler language extensions are present in the provided code fragment. The code uses standard C constructs: function definition and calls, pointer-to-char parameters with const, local variable declaration, comments, conditional statements, and return. There are no compiler-specific keywords or constructs such as __attribute__, __asm, asm(...), __builtin_*, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, inline assembly, GCC/clang pragmas or extensions, or Microsoft-specific extensions. The identifier int32 is the only non-standard type name shown; however this is a user typedef (not a language extension) and cannot be classified as a compiler language extension from the snippet alone — verification of whether int32 is a plain typedef or a compiler-provided extension should be done by inspecting the relevant header/typedef. Likewise, OS_rename, OS_cp, OS_remove and OS_SUCCESS are user symbols and not language extensions. Therefore there are no code fragments in this snippet that require investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
